org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction

Class SamResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction.SamResource

  • public class SamResource
extends java.lang.Object
    The SamResource class provides an access to a SeReader in which a SAM is running. The SamResource instances are produced by the SamResourceManager.

    The main method to use the SAM resource is to send ApduRequest and receive ApduResponse to the SAM.

    The SAM may be a physical chip inserted in a card reader or a virtual SAM provided by a HSM.

    The SAM is selected at construction time and its characteristics are made available through a CalypsoSam object member.

    The SamResource integrates a status flag indicating whether the SAM is currently in use for a transaction or not.

    The SamResourceManager provides methods to get an available SamResource matching the criteria defined by the application level and to free it after usage.

      • SamResource

        public SamResource(org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeReader seReader,
                   java.lang.String groupReference)
            throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException,
                   java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Construction of a SamResource
        Parameters:
        seReader - the SeReader with which one communicates with the SAM.
        groupReference - the target reference group to which the SAM should belong. May be null or empty if no group selection is required.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - if a reader error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SAM selection failed.

      • isSamMatching

        public boolean isSamMatching(SamIdentifier samIdentifier)
        Indicates whether the SamResource matches the provided SAM identifier.

        The test includes the SamRevision, serial number and group reference provided by the SamIdentifier.

        The SAM serial number can be null or empty, in this case all serial numbers are accepted. It can also be a regular expression target one or more specific serial numbers.

        The groupe reference can be null or empty to let all group references match but not empty the group reference must match the SamIdentifier to have the method returning true.

        Parameters:
        samIdentifier -
        Returns:
        true or false according to the result of the correspondence test
